data.title: Fall Hyperion by Dan Simmons, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Fall of Hyperion: A Novel (Hyperion Cantos, 2) by Simmons, Dan and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. 8.5 x 5.5", cloth backed boards, 517pp, extremities a little worn, spine ends lightly bumped, small spot on foredge of textblock else a nice copy in a rubbed and lightly edge-worn dustjacket. FIRST EDITION, FIRST STATE (with page 305 & 306 identical, but without the correction page laid in).

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. Gary Ruddell (illustrator). 1st Edition. Doubleday Foundation, NY, 1990. First Edition octavo red & brown Hardcover, gold gilt lettering on spine, with DJ, 517 pp. Highly acclaimed sequel to Hyperion. Unclipped DJ ($19.95) is mylar protected and fine. If you look closely, book has hint of foxing on front text block end and has the publisher's errata page (complete p. 305 which was missing from original printings). Else, book in fine, unmarked, clean, no bumps or other defects.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition. Stated first edition hardcover. Fine but for hint of soil to top block edge. Tight and square. The DJ in mylar is fine. Errata slip for missing p. 305 laid in at p. 305.; 8.2 X 5.9 X 1.3 inches; 517 pages.

First edition. Octavo, cloth backed boards. Sequel to HYPERION. ".beautifully written and have few equals for sheer, large scale sense of wonder." - Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-1033. Hugo and Nebula award nominee. Winner of the 1992 British Science Fiction Association Award for best novel. Errata slip laid in. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket. (29300).

First edition. Octavo, cloth backed boards. Sequel to HYPERION. ".beautifully written and have few equals for sheer, large scale sense of wonder." - Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-1033. Hugo and Nebula award nominee. Winner of the 1992 British Science Fiction Association Award for best novel. Errata slip laid in. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket. (31268).

First Edition. THE FALL OF HYPERION, Doubleday, 1990, first edition, fine in like full color pictorial dust-wrapper. (Make no mistake about this wonderful novel which is not a novel at all, but 1/2 of a novel - or if you please, 1/4 of a novel). SIGNED by the author.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. Gary Ruddell, cover art. (illustrator). 1st Edition 1st Printing. Doubleday, 1990. 1st Edition 1st Printing. Hardcover. Very Good/Near Fine. 8vo - over 7ÃÂ¾ - 9ÃÂ¾" tall. Gary Ruddell, cover art. The book has light foxing to the top of the page block. The book is missing page 305 and page 306 is printed twice. This book does not include the errata slip. The dust jacket is unclipped ($19.95). First Edition Stated. Signed by the author on the title page.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition. Signed, limited edition, published by Subterranean Press, 2013. One of 474 copies signed by Dan Simmons on the limitation page. This copy is number 172. Hardcover in jacket, price intact on jacket flap. Clean and bright. Binding strong. Minimal to no wear. Lovely copy in fine condition. Jacket now in fresh Mylar. Additional photos available upon request. Signed by Author.

Thick 8vo. [10], 517, [1] pp. Half-brown cloth over magenta-coloured boards, gilt lettering on spine, w/ d.j. cover art by Gary Ruddell, NF/NF copy. First edition, signed & stated, of this stunning sequel to "Hyperion" and the second title in Simmons' Hyperion Cantos space opera drawing from the poetry of John Keats, set against the backdrop of threats from the AI's who control the nets that bind the "Hegemony," and their possible project to create the Deus ex Machina. This novel won both the 1991 British Science Fiction and Locus Awards, and was nominated for both the Hugo and Nebula Awards.

Hardcover. Condition: As New. No Jacket. 1st Edition. Fine proof copies in light blue wraps of the US of Hyperion and also The Fall of Hyperion. Both are flat SIGNED by Simmons. Shrinkwrapped for protection. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1ST. Outstanding Copy - 4 Books. Sub Press Limiteds. All Are Number 2 Of 474 Signed Numbered Copies. Signed By The Author & Artist On The Special Limitation Page.Hyperion Has A Sketch To Tim Across From The Copyright Page By John Picacio. The Fall Of Hyperion Has A Sketch On The Half-Title Page By John Picacio. A First Edition, First Printing. Book Is In Fine Condition. Boards Are Clean, Not Bumped. Fore Edges Are Clean. Interior Is Clean And Legible. Not Remaindered. Dust Jacket Is In Fine Condition. Not Chipped Or Crinkled. Not Price Clipped. Dust Jacket Is Covered By Mylar Brodart. Thanks And Enjoy. The Books Come In A Custom Made Slipcase. Signed by Author(s). Book.
